title: Konstantin Adolfovic Semendyayev
summary: Konstantin Adolfovic Semendyayev or Semendyaev (Russian: Константин Адольфович Семендяев, German: Konstantin Adolfowitsch Semendjajew); born 9 December 1908 in Simferopol, died 15 November 1988) was a Russian engineer and applied mathematician. He worked in the department of applied mathematics of the Steklov Institute in Moscow. He carried out pioneering work in the area of numerical weather forecasting in Russia.
